paper_abstract: On a land suitability assessment map that is derived from an overlay of n parent maps, each bearing k land capability categories, how many permutations of land suitability ratings can there be when the rating scores are calculated by the commonly used rating and weighting method ( RAW method)? In the present paper, we estimate that this number is between nk(n(n-1)/2)/2 + k(n(n-1)/2) and k(n)!/(k(n-1)!k(n-2!) . . . k!)(k).
paper_title: How complex can a land suitability map be?
